Authors: Lingwei Hou, Fang Liu, Weijun Duan, lei cai
Title:
Two holomorphic new species of plant pathogenic
Colletotrichum
Keywords:
Anthracnose  Camellia  Monstera  Morphology  Philodenron 
Phylogeny  Taxonomy
Abstract:
Colletotrichum aracearum sp. nov. from Monstera delociosa
and Philodenron selloum, and C. camelliae-japonicae sp. nov. from
Camellia japonica, are described in this paper. Both species were
successfully induced for teleomorphic stages. Morphological comparisons
were made with similar species. Phylogenetic relationships were inferred
based on ITS, ACT, TEF, and GAPDH sequences. Colletotrichum
camelliae-japonicae belongs to the C. boninense species complex, while
C. aracearum does not nest within any known species complex and forms
sister clade to C. cliviae. This is the first report of Colletotrichum
species from hosts Monstera delociosa and Philodenron selloum.
